cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 100 miles SSW of Tampa, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north along the west coast of Florida, expected to turn north-northeast and accelerate across southeast Georgia toward the coastal Carolinas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north Florida Gulf Coast (near Steinhatchee River area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Altamaha Sound, GA, to South Santee River, SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of the St. Marys River to Altamaha Sound, GA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: southeast Georgia and South Carolina coasts, including the Port of Savannah area
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39-57 mph) are possible late Wednesday night into Thursday morning with a 47 % chance of occurrence; brief gusts could reach 50 kt in squalls.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–2 ft of surge possible along the Georgia coast, including areas near Savannah and the lower Savannah River.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches with isolated amounts up to 8 inches could cause flash and urban flooding in the port vicinity.
weather_observation.other_hazards: A few tornadoes are possible in outer rainbands; hazardous seas and dangerous rip currents expected.
